training_availability.week_days: Sunday, Saturday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday
Sunday, Saturday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

training_plan.coaching_notes: This 12-week plan follows a periodized structure designed to progressively develop aerobic capacity, FTP, and race-specific fitness. The program begins with a Foundation phase to build a solid aerobic base and improve endurance. Weeks 5-7 shift focus to FTP development and VO₂max improvement through structured intervals. The Peak phase in weeks 9-10 emphasizes sharpening race-specific power, while the final two weeks taper volume for event readiness. The strategic 3:1 loading pattern ensures recovery and adaptation, aligning with the athlete’s 7-hour weekly time budget. Long weekend rides capitalize on aerobic gains, while mid-week sessions target specific energy systems. The goal is to boost FTP from 236W to 260W (+10%) through progressive overload, emphasizing sweet spot and threshold zones.
training_plan.monitoring_guidance: Key performance indicators include TSS (training stress score), LTL (long-term load), STL (short-term load), and freshness (LTL-STL). Monitor fatigue signs such as decreased power at threshold, elevated resting heart rate, and persistent muscle soreness. Freshness below −25 for more than three consecutive days signals overtraining risk; reduce intensity or add recovery. Weekly TSS progression should match the plan’s target, with deviations adjusted based on perceived exertion and recovery. Conduct weekly power reviews to ensure FTP improvement aligns with expected gains. Aim for consistent gains in sweet spot and threshold intervals, with recovery weeks ensuring adaptation to the training load.

weekly_plan.phase_rationale: Establish aerobic base and lay endurance foundation.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride
workouts.detailed_description:
Ride mainly in Z2 today. You should be able to maintain conversation at this intensity. Don't be tempted to ride harder.

Warm Up:
15 mins in low Z2.

Main Set:
3 x (10 mins in upper Z2 + 3 min recoveries in low Z2).

Warm Down:
7 mins in low Z2.

Warm Down:

workouts.name: Tempo with spikes
workouts.detailed_description: Steady state efforts with a spikes in power to challenge your steady state system.
workouts.description: Steady state efforts with a spikes in power to challenge your steady state system.

workouts.name: Activations
workouts.detailed_description:
This is a session used to prepare your body for the next days activity. We use this to prime your muscles so that they are ready to perform and this is a proven way to maximise your performance.

The warm up section can be longer than prescribed below to find a safe road or if you feel your legs need more time.
workouts.description:

workouts.name: 1.5hr Base Fitness
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence.

The aim of this ride is to improve your efficiency at a low aerobic power, build mitochondria and increase your ability to utilise fat as a fuel source. Listen to your body and watch your HR to remain in zone 2.

Avoid going above zone 2 at all times and ride with constant pressure on the pedals on both up and down hills.

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops/ aero position so your muscles can develop strength in that position.

Ride at a comfortable cadence in the 80-100rpm range where possible.

Main Set:

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
10 mins in Z2,
5 x (30 secs in upper Z2 + 30 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
10 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
12 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
14 mins in upper Z2.

Warm Down:
7 mins in low Z2.

weekly_plan.phase_rationale: Allow the body to recover and adapt to the prior workload.

workouts.name: 5min Strength Efforts
workouts.detailed_description:
These sessions are to build muscular strength on the bike by increasing the amount of time your muscles are contracting each pedal stroke with a lower cadence (increased torque). By doing this, we aim to increase your force production throughout the pedal stroke.

It is okay to do these sessions as hill repeats where you coast/ free wheel a bit down the hill during your recovery period to start your next effort.

It is important if you are doing this session on the trainer or on flat road to pedal at a high cadence (85-95rpm) to flush your legs out during the recovery periods.

Ideally this session is done on the ergo or on a hill with a steady gradient.

If completing on the ergo, you can make the warm up and cool down 10min.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Bike
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
10 mins in Z2,
5 x (20 secs in Z3 + 40 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
3 x (8 mins in upper Z2 + 30 sec recoveries in low Z2),
3 x (5 mins in upper Z2 + 30 sec recoveries in low Z2).

Warm Down:
5 mins in low Z2.

weekly_plan.phase_rationale: Begin FTP-focused work to develop power at threshold.

workouts.name: 3x12' Tempo
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim here is to target time in zone 3 and increase your muscular endurance with sustained pressure on the pedals at a moderate intensity.

These shouldn't be too hard but should start to hurt towards the end of the last efforts.

Change position from hoods to drops throughout these efforts to engage different muscle groups.

Stick to prescribed power targets as we are targeting a specific HR and power zone for aerobic capacity.

workouts.name: Threshold Efforts
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
10 mins in low Z2,
5 x (15 secs in Z4 + 45 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
7 mins in upper Z4 + 3 mins recovery in low Z2,
6 mins in upper Z4 + 3 mins recovery in low Z2,
5 mins in upper Z4 + 3 mins recovery in low Z2,
4 mins in upper Z4 + 3 mins recovery in low Z2.

Warm Down:
5 mins in upper Z2,
5 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Sweet Spot Repeats
workouts.detailed_description:
Efforts just below threshold.

At this percentage of FTP, you are at a physiological point where the lactate clearance and utilisation is at a steady state. This type of training will improve your ability to clear accumulated lactate when necessary and improve your muscular endurance.

If you are aiming to improve your climbing, do these as repeats on a climb. If you want to improve your speed on the flat, do these on a flat road without interruptions.

You can also complete these workouts on the trainer as prescribed below.

workouts.name: Sub Threshold Efforts
workouts.detailed_description:
These longer bike sessions are mostly done at an easy/steady Z2 effort, but there is a main set of long efforts at just below your threshold pace. These will help increase your threshold power without leaving you feeling excessively tired afterwards.

Warm Up:
20 mins in Z2.

Main Set:
4 x (10 mins in upper Z3 + 5 min recoveries in Z2).

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

weekly_plan.phase_rationale: Increase VO₂max and refine FTP capacity.

workouts.name: 40/20s (5min)
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim is to accumulate a decent amount of time in and above zone 5. You will get a short 20sec rest that allows your legs to recover but your heart rate won't drop too much and then you have to go again.

The first couple of sets should be done to target power. If you feel good, you can treat the 40sec effort as a max effort to really push your body to the limit.

If you do this session on the ergo, please don't use ERG mode as the lag in resistance can be difficult and you will also limit yourself in the power range given sometimes. You are better off doing this as a free ride in level mode and producing the power yourself.

Ensure your cadence doesn't drop too much in your recovery period. Recovery cadence should be >85rpm when possible.

workouts.name: Above and Below Threshold
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
15 mins in low Z2,
5 x (10 secs in Z4 + 50 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
5 x (4 mins in Z3 + 2 mins in Z5 + 2 mins in low Z2).

Warm Down:
5 mins in low Z2.
workouts.description:
Warm Up:
15 mins in low Z2,
5 x (10 secs in Z4 + 50 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
5 x (4 mins in Z3 + 2 mins in Z5 + 2 mins in low Z2).

Warm Down:
5 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: 1.5hr Base Fitness @ 60-65% Threshold
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in low to mid Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence.

This is slightly easier than a typical zone 2 ride at 60-65% threshold. The aim here to reduce the pressure on the legs and bring the heart rate into the desired zone to see what response your body has.

The aim of this ride is to improve your efficiency at a low aerobic power, build mitochondria and increase your ability to utilise fat as a fuel source. Listen to your body and watch your HR to remain in zone 2.

Avoid going above zone 2 at all times and ride with constant pressure on the pedals on both up and down hills.

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops/ aero position so your muscles can develop strength in that position.

Ride at a comfortable cadence in the 80-100rpm range where possible.

10 mins in low Z2.

Warm Up:
10 mins in low Z2,
5 x (15 secs in Z4 + 45 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
6 mins in upper Z4 + 3 mins recovery in low Z2,
7 mins in upper Z4 + 3 mins recovery in low Z2,
8 mins in upper Z4 + 3 mins recovery in low Z2.

Warm Down:
5 mins in upper Z2,
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: 3x12' Tempo
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim here is to target time in zone 3 and increase your muscular endurance with sustained pressure on the pedals at a moderate intensity.

These shouldn't be too hard but should start to hurt towards the end of the last efforts.

Change position from hoods to drops throughout these efforts to engage different muscle groups.

Stick to prescribed power targets as we are targeting a specific HR and power zone for aerobic capacity.

workouts.name: Sub Threshold Efforts
workouts.detailed_description:
These longer bike sessions are mostly done at an easy/steady Z2 effort, but there is a main set of long efforts at just below your threshold pace. These will help increase your threshold power without leaving you feeling excessively tired afterwards.

Warm Up:
20 mins in Z2.

Main Set:
4 x (10 mins in upper Z3 + 5 min recoveries in Z2).

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

Warm Down:

weekly_plan.phase_rationale: Reduce intensity and volume to consolidate gains.

workouts.name: 5min Strength Efforts
workouts.detailed_description:
These sessions are to build muscular strength on the bike by increasing the amount of time your muscles are contracting each pedal stroke with a lower cadence (increased torque). By doing this, we aim to increase your force production throughout the pedal stroke.

It is okay to do these sessions as hill repeats where you coast/ free wheel a bit down the hill during your recovery period to start your next effort.

It is important if you are doing this session on the trainer or on flat road to pedal at a high cadence (85-95rpm) to flush your legs out during the recovery periods.

Ideally this session is done on the ergo or on a hill with a steady gradient.

If completing on the ergo, you can make the warm up and cool down 10min.
workouts.description:

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
10 mins in Z2,
5 x (30 secs in upper Z2 + 30 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
10 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
8 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
6 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
4 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
2 mins in upper Z2.

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.
workouts.description:
Warm Up:
10 mins in Z2,
5 x (30 secs in upper Z2 + 30 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
10 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
8 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
6 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
4 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
2 mins in upper Z2.

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Tempo with spikes
workouts.detailed_description: Steady state efforts with a spikes in power to challenge your steady state system.
workouts.description: Steady state efforts with a spikes in power to challenge your steady state system.

workouts.name: 1.5hr Base Fitness
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence.

The aim of this ride is to improve your efficiency at a low aerobic power, build mitochondria and increase your ability to utilise fat as a fuel source. Listen to your body and watch your HR to remain in zone 2.

Avoid going above zone 2 at all times and ride with constant pressure on the pedals on both up and down hills.

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops/ aero position so your muscles can develop strength in that position.

Ride at a comfortable cadence in the 80-100rpm range where possible.

workouts.name: Threshold Efforts
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
10 mins in low Z2,
5 x (15 secs in Z4 + 45 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
6 mins in upper Z4 + 3 mins recovery in low Z2,
7 mins in upper Z4 + 3 mins recovery in low Z2,
8 mins in upper Z4 + 3 mins recovery in low Z2.

Warm Down:
5 mins in upper Z2,
10 mins in low Z2.
workouts.description:
Warm Up:
10 mins in low Z2,
5 x (15 secs in Z4 + 45 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
6 mins in upper Z4 + 3 mins recovery in low Z2,

Warm Down:

workouts.name: 40/20s (5min)
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim is to accumulate a decent amount of time in and above zone 5. You will get a short 20sec rest that allows your legs to recover but your heart rate won't drop too much and then you have to go again.

The first couple of sets should be done to target power. If you feel good, you can treat the 40sec effort as a max effort to really push your body to the limit.

If you do this session on the ergo, please don't use ERG mode as the lag in resistance can be difficult and you will also limit yourself in the power range given sometimes. You are better off doing this as a free ride in level mode and producing the power yourself.

Ensure your cadence doesn't drop too much in your recovery period. Recovery cadence should be >85rpm when possible.

Warm Down:
5 mins in upper Z2,
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: 1.5hr Base Fitness @ 60-65% Threshold
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in low to mid Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence.

This is slightly easier than a typical zone 2 ride at 60-65% threshold. The aim here to reduce the pressure on the legs and bring the heart rate into the desired zone to see what response your body has.

The aim of this ride is to improve your efficiency at a low aerobic power, build mitochondria and increase your ability to utilise fat as a fuel source. Listen to your body and watch your HR to remain in zone 2.

Avoid going above zone 2 at all times and ride with constant pressure on the pedals on both up and down hills.

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops/ aero position so your muscles can develop strength in that position.

Ride at a comfortable cadence in the 80-100rpm range where possible.

workouts.name: Activations
workouts.detailed_description:
This is a session used to prepare your body for the next days activity. We use this to prime your muscles so that they are ready to perform and this is a proven way to maximise your performance.

The warm up section can be longer than prescribed below to find a safe road or if you feel your legs need more time.

key_trends.title: Increased Ride Frequency
key_trends.description: Ride frequency improved significantly from 0.82 rides/week to 1.93 rides/week, showing a 133.8% increase. This suggests better consistency in training.

key_trends.title: Higher Elevation Gain
key_trends.description: Total elevation gain increased by 18.9% to 7475 m, with weekly elevation gain rising by 127.4%. This indicates more climbing-focused rides.

key_trends.title: Decline in Average Power
key_trends.description: Average power dropped from 147.4 W to 141.2 W, a 4.2% decrease. This suggests a potential decline in sustained effort or intensity.

key_trends.title: Improved Long Ride Capability
key_trends.description: The maximum ride distance increased to 83.2 km, the longest ride recorded in the recent period, showcasing improved endurance.

key_trends.title: Cross-Training Dominance
key_trends.description: Cycling accounted for only 11.3% of total training activities, with a high focus on strength (37.9%) and cardio (27.7%).

insights.title: Consistency is Improving
insights.description: The significant increase in ride frequency and weekly elevation gain shows better training consistency and focus.

insights.title: Intensity Needs Attention
insights.description: The decrease in average power and heart rate metrics indicates a need to focus on higher-intensity training to address power loss.

insights.title: Cross-Training Balance
insights.description: The current cross-training balance, with only 11.3% cycling, may not optimally support endurance goals like raising FTP.

insights.title: Recovery Interference
insights.description: Several high-interference events between strength and cycling were identified, potentially affecting performance and recovery.

insights.title: Endurance Gains Evident
insights.description: The increase in long ride capability and elevation gain highlights improvements in endurance and climbing strength.

short_term.text: Incorporate structured intervals targeting Zone 4 (FTP) to improve power output and intensity.
Adjust strength workout timing to avoid interference with key cycling sessions.
Focus on recovery post-climbing-focused rides to sustain weekly elevation gains.

long_term.text: Increase cycling percentage in overall training to at least 60-75% for better FTP and endurance focus.
Plan polarized training (80/20 rule) to balance high- and low-intensity efforts for sustained FTP gains.
Incorporate more indoor power-based rides to control intensity and target FTP improvements.

recovery_nutrition.text: Ensure a protein intake of 20-25g within 30 minutes post-ride for muscle repair.
Hydrate adequately post-ride, especially after high-elevation or sweat-heavy sessions.
Include complex carbohydrates post-training to replenish glycogen stores and support endurance recovery.

load_balance.recommendation: Increase cycling focus to align with endurance goals. Aim for at least 60-75% cycling in training mix.

interference_events.explanation: Strength < 36h before cycling; Leg-focused strength before cycling
Strength < 36h before cycling; Leg-focused strength before cycling
Strength < 36h before cycling; Leg-focused strength before cycling

recommendations.text: Space strength and cycling sessions by at least 36-48 hours to minimize interference.
Prioritize cycling before strength on key endurance training days.
Assess recovery needs and adjust training intensity accordingly.
